user.title: Climate Group Helper
user.description: Create a virtual controller that synchronizes multiple heating/cooling units. This group acts as a single smart entity in your dashboard and automations, consolidating states and commands.

data_description.name: A friendly name for your group (e.g. 'Living Room' or 'Whole House').
data_description.entities: Select the climate devices (thermostats, ACs) to include in this group.

error.no_entities: You must select at least one climate device.
error.invalid_entity: One or more selected devices are not valid climate entities.
error.duplicate_name: A climate group with this name already exists.
error.unavailable_entities: Some selected devices are unavailable. The group will be created but may not work fully until they obey.

init.title: Configure Climate Group
init.description: Manage members, sensor logic, timings, and synchronization behavior.

members.title: Members & Modes
members.description: Select your devices and choose how the group combines their states and features. 'Strategy' defines the group's behavior when members are in different modes.

data_description.entities: Add or remove devices. Removing devices stops them from being controlled by the group.
data_description.hvac_mode_strategy: Strategy for calculating the group's state from its members (e.g. if one is 'heat' and another is 'off').
data_description.feature_strategy: Determines which features (e.g. preset modes, fan modes) are available on the group when members have different capabilities.

temperature.title: Temperature Settings
temperature.description: Configure how the group handles temperature aggregation and setpoints. External sensors will override member readings if selected.

data_description.temp_current_avg: How the group summarizes sensor readings from its members.
data_description.temp_target_avg: How the group calculates the target setpoint to send to its members.
data_description.temp_target_round: Only applies to values sent to devices, not to current/displayed values.
data_description.temp_sensors: Use external sensors instead of member readings. These become the sole source of truth for the group's temperature.
data_description.temp_update_targets: Write the external sensor value to number entities (e.g. TRV calibration offsets). Useful for keeping thermostats aware of actual room temperature.
data_description.temp_calibration_mode: Absolute: Send value directly. Offset: Send delta (External - TRV Internal). Scaled: Send as Integer x100 (e.g. 21.5 -> 2150).
data_description.calibration_heartbeat: Periodically force-sync calibration to entities even if temperature hasn't changed. Set to 0 to disable.

humidity.title: Humidity Settings
humidity.description: Configure humidity aggregation and external sensors. Note that many thermostats only report humidity and don't allow control.

data_description.humidity_current_avg: How the group summarizes sensor readings from its members.
data_description.humidity_target_avg: How the group calculates the target setpoint to send to its members.
data_description.humidity_target_round: Only applies to values sent to devices, not to current/displayed values.
data_description.humidity_sensors: Use external sensors instead of member readings. These become the sole source of truth for the group's humidity.
data_description.humidity_update_targets: Write the external sensor value to number entities. Useful for dehumidifier calibration.

timings.title: Communication Timings
timings.description: Configure how the 'Virtual Controller' interacts with your network. Correct timings prevent Zigbee/Z-Wave congestion and increase command reliability.

data_description.debounce_delay: Time to wait before sending commands. Higher values prevent 'machine gun' commands when sliding controls, but feel slower.
data_description.retry_attempts: How many times to resend a command if a device doesn't respond. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.retry_delay: Pause between retry attempts. Giving devices a moment to recover can improve reliability.

sync.title: Sync Mode & Attributes
sync.description: Control what happens when someone physically adjusts a device. WARNING: To avoid 'Climate Wars', ensure a device is not assigned to multiple groups with active Sync Mode.

data_description.sync_mode: Standard: Group shows aggregated state but doesn't enforce it. Mirror: Changes on one device are copied to all others. Lock: Manual changes on devices are reverted to match the group.
data_description.sync_attributes: Attributes selected here will be enforced in Lock/Mirror modes. Unselected attributes allow for local control (e.g. sync temperature but let users change fan speed locally).

window_control.title: Window Control
window_control.description: Configure automatic heating/cooling shutdown when windows are opened. Both sensors are optional - leave empty to disable.

data_description.window_mode: Enable or disable climate group based on window/door sensors. When enabled, HVAC mode sets to 'off' when windows open and restores to the previous state when closed.
data_description.room_sensor: Binary sensor for the room's own window/door. Triggers the shorter delay.
data_description.zone_sensor: Binary sensor for other windows/doors in the zone/floor. Triggers the longer delay.
data_description.room_open_delay: Time to wait after room window opens before turning off heating.
data_description.zone_open_delay: Time to wait after zone window opens before turning off heating.
data_description.close_delay: Time to wait after all windows close before restoring heating.

schedule.title: Schedule & Timers
schedule.description: Configure automation for the group. Link a schedule entity to automate changes and enable periodic synchronization.

data_description.schedule_entity: Select a schedule entity. The schedule's 'Additional data' field can contain YAML with attributes like 'temperature: 20.5' or 'hvac_mode: heat'.
data_description.resync_interval: Force-sync members to the target state every X minutes. Ensures devices stay on schedule even if adjusted manually or commands are missed. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.override_duration: The duration for manual overrides. After this time, the group automatically reverts to the current schedule. Set to 0 to skip the override period.
data_description.persist_changes: If enabled, changes to the schedule itself will be ignored while a manual override is active. Re-applies the current schedule only after the override expires.

data_description.expose_smart_sensors: Creates extra sensor entities for the group's temperature and humidity (useful for graphs).
data_description.expose_member_entities: Creates an attribute listing all member entity IDs.
data_description.ignore_off_members: If enabled, the group will NOT turn on members that are currently Off. (Partial Sync)
data_description.min_temp_off: If enabled, sends the device's minimum temperature (e.g. 5°C) when turning the group off. (Force Valve Close)

error.no_entities: At least one climate device must remain in the group.

options.standard: Standard – Aggregates state only, manual changes are allowed
options.mirror: Mirror – Manual changes on one device update all members
options.lock: Lock – Reverts manual changes to match the group state

options.normal: Normal – The group adopts the most common member mode
options.off_priority: Off Priority – If any member is Off, the whole group is Off
options.auto: Auto – Smart switching between Normal and Off Priority

options.intersection: Intersection – Support features only if ALL members have them
options.union: Union – Support all features present on ANY member

set_temperature.name: Set Temperature
set_temperature.description: Set the target temperature for the entire group.

conflicting_features.description:
